intro: Gunisanthus mollis, commonly known as the velvetleaf. It is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a soft, velvety texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange and are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Gunisanthus mollis is often found in wetland habitats and is adapted to thrive in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
